description: Users may experience remote code execution vulnerabilities on Windows Server environments, specifically affecting the Windows DNS Server across multiple builds. When this issue is present, end users could notice unexpected behaviors such as unresponsive services, inability to resolve DNS queries, or potential unauthorized code execution on critical servers. This vulnerability impacts builds including Windows Server 2022 (10.0.20348.2402), Windows Server 2019 (10.0.17763.5696), and Windows Server 2016 (10.0.14393.6897), with corresponding KB articles KB-5036909 and KB-5036896. The overall impact could lead to various operational disruptions within an organization's network and necessitate urgent attention from system administrators to apply the provided security updates.
